Even if marriage definitely equaled reproduction, and we discouraged it, there'd still be a lot of people. People tend to want to marry, even if you discourage it :P
 
 And they often want to have kids too. You'd have to REALLY discourage it. And then you have to figure that those born today will at least be living until 45 before they cannot breed anymore (in the case of women)
 
 So you'd have 45 years before you had to really worry about population loss.

What is the Marriage Penalty?
 
 In my country, marriage is preferential from a tax point of view.
georged

What is the Marriage Penalty?
 
 In my country, marriage is preferential from a tax point of view.

 
 In short, a higher tax deduction is allowed for each single person in a union than two married people filing jointly. There are other issues based on the same principal, but that's the major flaw.

get the govt out of marriage
